label: phenotype
description: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.

label: temperature range (metabolic viability)
description: The span of temperatures within which a microorganism can maintain metabolic functions and population viability.

label: growth temperature observation
description: An observation specializing temperature observation for general growth temperature data.

label: pH range (growth tolerance)
description: The span of pH values within which an organism can grow

label: pH optimum (metabolic efficiency)
description: The specific hydrogen ion concentration at which a microorganism achieves its maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.
